summary: When COVID-19 vaccines became available, the federal government sent most doses to states to distribute but also set up its own vaccine distribution programs. State and local health officials said the federal programs helped higher-risk groups get vaccinated. But they also said they had little to no information about how the federal doses were allocated—making it difficult for states to allocate their own doses when...
title: COVID-19: HHS Agencies' Planned Reviews of Vaccine Distribution and Communication Efforts Should Include Stakeholder Perspectives
